title: MaterialMouse69
author: MaterialMouse69
content: Hi I'm a newbie here and would love to ask for advices on how to have a good background here?Is merit important and should I interact more? Can you guys suggest any advice thanks a lot!

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: People mainly want Merits so that they can join signature campaigns and (shit)post to earn some ka-ching.But if you're looking to earn, contribute to the discussions here, or post helpful threads. They will come naturally.I started participating in discussions in 2018. Took me a whole good 5 years to reach this stage.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Many had shared important links that will help you so there is no need for me to be repeating what they had written. However, I will like you to have it at the back of your mind that the more you chase merits the less you would get. Let it chase you, just let your posts be of quality, be natural, and the merit will certainly chase you.And when you post a new topic, let it be educative and have meaning rather than asking questions that will only fetch merits to good posts underneath.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Quote from: MaterialMouse69 on March 08, 2023, 06:20:11 AMIs merit important and should I interact more?  Well, I see merits as a by product of a properly arranged, constructive and educated post. Is it important? Yeah. As it gives you the motivation to do more. But mind you, in your search for merits while you post, ensure to be open to criticism as this helps you grow. To the b part of your question: yeah, you def need to interact more. (Intelligently, if I might add) as this helps to broaden your horizons and makes for more room to research and do better.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: MaterialMouse69 on March 08, 2023, 06:20:11 AMIs merit important and should I interact more?  Merit is needed to progress in the rank ladder, nothing more.Now higher ranks are able to join signature campaigns with higher pay so it ends up being a merit-hunting game for many users on this forum. After all who does not want some coins from discussions in this forum?Do read old threads, post regularly, solving problems and helping others, you will eventually gather enough merits to grow your account's rank. Obviously the merit sources are biased towards older users, but you can become a "newbie of the month" too.

comments.author: bullrun2024bro
comments.body: Quote from: MaterialMouse69 on March 08, 2023, 06:20:11 AMHi I'm a newbie here and would love to ask for advices on how to have a good background here? Is merit important and should I interact more? Write quality content and try to be helpful and you won't have any issues getting merit. Write shitposts and spam posts and you won't get any merit, no matter how many posts you create.Generally speaking: Try to find your way around the forum, read up, learn about the forum features and try to help other members. Then you won't have any problems getting merit.Start here: Beginners & Help(Reminder: Don't beg for merit. Please don't like that and won't give you any, if you're begging.)

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: MaterialMouse69 on March 08, 2023, 06:20:11 AMIs merit important and should I interact more? What's your reason for registering an account here on the forum? If it's to learn more about Bitcoin and invest a bit when you've acquired more knowledge, then the forum ranks and politics should not really bother you. Merits would more or less be pats on the back for an educative post or response.But if you are more focused on advancing in the forum, knowing how it works beyond the rules and maybe entering a signature campaign, then you should understand how ranks work.Secondly, you should not interact more than you wish to. If reading and learning without commenting works for you, do that

Achievement is certainly the most important thing for your achievement to the next level, interaction is certain, but meaningful.QuoteCan you guys suggest any advice thanks a lot!The most important advice before you do anything, it's important to read: Topic: Unofficial Forum Rules & Guildelines (Tagalog Version)

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Quote from: MaterialMouse69 on March 08, 2023, 06:20:11 AMHow can I increase my merit?I just checked your profile and you don't have any merits let alone asking how to increase it. The right question you should ask is, "how can I earn merits?"To answer how you will earn merits. First you have to understand what you are good at, develop more on it and then start helping people solve their problems. The more problems you solve here, the more merits you will have.So you have to give out something in order to recieve. But do not be too merit conscious, because if you are, you may never earn it.
